intro: Stevenia cheiranthoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
